docs.snippet: Spain will take on Australia in its final Group B match Monday in the knowledge that defeat will officially make its defense of the World Cup the worst in history.
docs.lead_paragraph: Spain will take on Australia in its final Group B match Monday in the knowledge that defeat will officially make its defense of the World Cup the worst in history.

headline.main: Spain Aims to Avoid Worst Ever World Cup Defense
headline.print_headline: Spain Aims to Avoid Worst Ever World Cup Defense

docs.snippet: There will be no kisses from Queen Elizabeth for Italy striker Mario Balotelli after his team wilted in the Brazilian heat against Costa Rica and slumped to a 1-0 defeat.
docs.lead_paragraph: There will be no kisses from Queen Elizabeth for Italy striker Mario Balotelli after his team wilted in the Brazilian heat against Costa Rica and slumped to a 1-0 defeat.

headline.main: No Royal Kisses for Balotelli as Italy Draw a Blank

docs.snippet: Costa Rica's five-man backline and lightning counter-attacks may look like a defensive set-up but four goals in two thrilling group games suggests their "tico-taka" system could yet take them deep into the World Cup.

headline.main: 'Tico-Taka' Takes Costa Rica Into World Cup Last 16

docs.snippet: Striker Wayne Rooney says teams that succeed at the World Cup are nasty and cynical and England needs to play that way if it wants to win.

docs.snippet: England players Wayne Rooney and Joe Hart said on Saturday they were devastated by England's early elimination from the World Cup and apologised to the country for their failure.

docs.snippet: In the weeks leading up to the World Cup, reports of strikes, demonstrations, unfinished stadiums and inevitable traffic problems dominated the news. But since the first match kicked off on June 12, goal-filled games, superstar performances and...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the weeks leading up to the World Cup, reports of strikes, demonstrations, unfinished stadiums and inevitable traffic problems dominated the news. But since the first match kicked off on June 12, goal-filled games, superstar performances and upsets have delighted fans — particularly those from Latin America.

headline.main: The World Cup So Far, How Are Things Going?
headline.print_headline: The World Cup So Far, How Are Things Going?

docs.snippet: England's failure to reach the knockout stages of the World Cup is a bitter pill to swallow but a young batch of talent in the squad will make for a brighter future, manager Roy Hodgson said on Saturday.
docs.lead_paragraph: England's failure to reach the knockout stages of the World Cup is a bitter pill to swallow but a young batch of talent in the squad will make for a brighter future, manager Roy Hodgson said on Saturday.

headline.main: Young Guns Can Lead England Forward, Hodgson Says
headline.print_headline: Young Guns Can Lead England Forward, Hodgson Says

docs.snippet: With England already out of contention, Wayne Rooney said, “It’s vital we take the pain we are feeling now and remember that, and the next tournament, we don’t want to feel that again.”
docs.lead_paragraph: With England already out of contention, Wayne Rooney said, “It’s vital we take the pain we are feeling now and remember that, and the next tournament, we don’t want to feel that again.”
docs.abstract: World Cup Roundup; Argentina earns a 1-0 victory over Iran to advance to Round of 16; other tournament news noted.

headline.main: World Cup 2014: England’s Wayne Rooney Expresses His Disappointment
